definitions: To have clothing, jewelry, or accessories on one's body.
To deteriorate or be damaged by continuous use or friction.
To cause something to deteriorate or be damaged by continuous use or friction.
To have a particular expression or appearance on one's face.
To tolerate or endure something difficult or unpleasant.
examples: She likes to wear bright colors.
The carpet started to wear thin.
The constant rubbing will wear a hole in the fabric.
He wore a frown all morning.
The stress of the job began to wear on him.
